intro: Ardisia quelchii, commonly known as the Chinese evergreen or red root, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and showy red berries. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Ardisia quelchii thrives in shady, moist environments and is popular as an ornamental plant in gardens.
